title: Should my conclusion be on a separate page in a research paper in the APA format? - Quora

response.answer_text: (A2A) It should be the last paragraph in the Discussion section. It does not have a separate “Conclusions” heading. The Discussion section is only moved to a separate page for appearance and ease of reading if it would be, say, only two lines on the previous page if you didn’t move it. Check this out: APA Sample Paper // Purdue Writing Labhttps://www.apa.org/pubs/authors/new-author-guide.pdf(look at page 8)

No. APA does not require you to put your concluding paragraph on a separate page. What is required to begin on separate page by APA are: First page of a new chapterFirst page of your Reference ListAppendicesPrelim pages (and this is usual anyway, APA or not).
